choices.D: in the data center, because all user traffic will be seen there
choices.C: in the core, because all traffic will be seen there
choices.A: at the edge of the network so that user traffic will be seen
choices.B: at the central site, because all traffic from the remotes will be seen there.

questions.question_text: Your enterprise customer has asked where they should deploy flow monitoring in their network to monitor traffic between branch offices. What is your design recommendation?

discussion.content: Without knowing the details about wan design, i would better choice A

choices.D: Use SNMP encryption for transport confidentiality.
choices.A: Restrict access to the specific SNMP engine IDs in use.
choices.C: Use a combination of alphanumeric characters for the community strings.
choices.B: Use ACLs to allow only specific IP addresses to poll SNMP.

questions.question_text: Which two practices should you implement to increase SNMPv1 security? (Choose two.)

Refer to the exhibit. You are designing a Layer 2 VPN for a large financial company. Currently, 90% of traffic from the company's remote branches comes to HQ.
The company has hubs and old switches at remotes that do not have dot1q capability. However, it does not have the budget to invest in new equipment at the remote branches.
In addition to converting the remote branches to Layer 2 VPN, the company wants to connect all the branches to the HQ site, to ensure that the branches have access to dot1q capability. How can this customer's requirements be met, or if they cannot, why not?
//IMG//

discussion.content: The quality of question reminds me of turkish kebab seller, Orhun Ergun, who needs to study English better, before consult cisco on ccde exam.

choices.A: They cannot be met, because an intelligent switch is required at the remote branches to enable EoMPLS from site to site.
choices.D: They can be met, but EoMPLS in port mode requires VPWS.
choices.B: They can be met, but require Ethernet to dot1q interworking between the PEs.
choices.C: They cannot be met, because EoMPLS in port mode requires VPLS.

choices.A: Spanning tree at the service provider side only must be enabled.
choices.C: Flex Links at the service provider side only must be enabled.
choices.D: Flex Links at the customer side only must be enabled.
choices.B: Spanning tree at the customer side only must be enabled.
choices.E: EtherChannel at the service provider side and the customer side must be enabled.
choices.G: Flex Links at the service provider side and the customer side must be enabled.
choices.F: Spanning tree at the service provider side and the customer side must be enabled.

questions.question_text: A service provider has a Resilient Ethernet Protocol ring running as a metro backbone between its locations in one city. A customer wants to connect one site with one box redundant to the Resilient Ethernet Protocol ring at two different service provider locations. How can this be done without producing any Layer 2 loops within the network design?

choices.F: To force two routers to become a DR and a BDR, the IP OSPF priority can be set to zero at all other OSPF routers.
choices.A: It is a best practice that the routers with the most powerful hardware should take the role of the DR and BDR.
choices.B: If the IP OSPF priority is the same for all routers, the highest loopback IP address and router ID will decide which routers will take the DR and BDR role during the selection process.
choices.D: To select the DR and BDR, the IP OSPF priority must be set to a lower value than the default value at the DR and BDR during the selection process.
choices.E: The role for the DR and BDR will be selected when a new OSPF router comes up.
choices.C: To select the DR and BDR, the IP OSPF priority must be set to a higher value than the default value at the DR and BDR during the selection process.

discussion.content:
ABF is correct.
OSPF prefers loopback interfaces over physical interfaces for stability

questions.question_text:
A company is planning to connect its 30 sites with a VPLS WAN backbone. A router at each site should establish neighborships with all other routers using the
OSPF routing protocol. Which three points must be considered regarding DR and BDR when different router platforms are used? (Choose three.)
